title: How to Make Anise Cookies

steps.headline: Mix the butter, sugar, warm milk or water, egg and salt just until the sugar is dissolved, then add and mix the anise and fennel.
Sift the flour and baking powder together then add to the blended liquids slowly.
Add flour as needed to make a soft dough.
Cover completely and put in the fridge for 2 or 3 hours.
Dust surface with flour.
steps.description: Start with half the dough ball and roll out to about ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) thickness (or 3 mm)

steps.headline: Use cookie cutters or small glass to cut out cookie shapes.
Space the cookies on a greased cookie sheet, giving them room to expand.
Finally brush the surface of the cookies with the glazing mixture.
Bake at 350 F for 8 - 12 minutes, checking cookies.
Repeat for the last half of the cookie dough.
When cooled you can decorate them with chocolate or peanut butter or any jam you like with nut or walnut.

text: Mix the butter, sugar, warm milk or water, egg and salt just until the sugar is dissolved, then add and mix the anise and fennel.  Sift the flour and baking powder together then add to the blended liquids slowly.  Add flour as needed to make a soft dough.  Cover completely and put in the fridge for 2 or 3 hours.  Dust surface with flour. Start with half the dough ball and roll out to about ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) thickness (or 3 mm) Use cookie cutters or small glass to cut out cookie shapes.  Space the cookies on a greased cookie sheet, giving them room to expand.  Finally brush the surface of the cookies with the glazing mixture.  Bake at 350 F for 8 - 12 minutes, checking cookies.  Repeat for the last half of the cookie dough.  When cooled you can decorate them with chocolate or peanut butter or any jam you like with nut or walnut.
